thread.title: Williams scores 19 points, Knicks beat Celtics 101-95 to stay unbeaten in preseason
thread.title_full: Williams scores 19 points, Knicks beat Celtics 101-95 to stay unbeaten in preseason

title: Williams scores 19 points, Knicks beat Celtics 101-95 to stay unbeaten in preseason
text:
Williams scores 19 points, Knicks beat Celtics 101-95 to stay unbeaten in preseason By BRIAN MAHONEY AP Basketball Writer   10:13   10:13   
People: Photo Gallery: 
Click to view (4 Photos) 
NEW YORK â€” Derrick Williams scored 19 points in another strong performance and the New York Knicks beat the Boston Celtics 101-95 on Friday night to remain unbeaten in the preseason. 
The No. 2 overall pick of the 2011 draft who struggled in Minnesota and Sacramento just missed his third straight 20-point game and made a 3-pointer with 2:11 left after the Celtics had closed within two points. 
Isaiah Thomas scored 13 in Boston's first preseason loss. 
CELTICS: Jared Sullinger grabbed 10 rebounds but shot 1 of 8. 
KNICKS: Kyle O'Quinn finished with 13 points and 11 rebounds. 
INJURY UPDATES: Arron Afflalo started in his first action of the preseason for the Knicks after recovering from a sore left hamstring and scored eight points. ... Rookie Kristaps Porzingis sat out a second straight game with a strained left quadriceps but is expected to start Saturday at Charlotte. 
WELCOME BACK: David Lee, who played for the Knicks from 2005-10, got a nice cheer when he was announced with Boston's starting lineup. 
SEE YOU SOON: The Atlantic Division rivals meet again Thursday in Boston. 
UP NEXT: The Celtics host Brooklyn on Monday. New York visits Charlotte on Saturday.
